newsitem.title: DENMARK: Tele Danmark to cut mobile call charges.
newsitem.headline: Tele Danmark to cut mobile call charges.

text.p: Danish telecoms group Tele Danmark said on Friday that it would cut mobile telephone call charges from May 26.
A Tele Danmark statement said that charges for standard subscriptions would fall to 2.10 crowns per minute for daytime GSM calls from 2.35 crowns.

For users of the NMT 900 system prices would be reduced to 1.75 crowns per minute from 1.95. For off-peak calls after 19.30 (1730 GMT) prices for both systems are to fall to 1.05 crowns per minute. --Steve Weizman, Copenhagen newsroom +45 33969650
